definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: Spitting in the street is considered to be very bad mannered.
sentences.chinese: 拂逆地吐痰，在街上吐痰是很紧张的坏习气。

sentences.english: There were armoured personnel carriers and tanks on the streets…
sentences.chinese: 街上有装甲运兵车和坦克。

sentences.english: My mother died early… Hu Defu quit. < /p> < p> shangjingwu walking in the street, everyone feels like is juntong killer.
sentences.chinese: 汤敬武走在街上，感觉每个人都像是军统的杀手。

sentences.english: The brawl in the street could be heard in the house nearby .
sentences.chinese: 在附近的房子里都能听到街上的争吵声。

sentences.english: This child never felt so well as when he was in the street.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子从来就只觉得街上才是他安身的地方。

sentences.english: From now on you are the official Statue of Liberty of this street.
sentences.chinese: 从今以后，你就是这条街上名正言顺的自由神像。
他们穿四轮旱冰鞋在街上滑行。

sentences.english: Have you ever seen a one -legged dog making its way down the street?
sentences.chinese: 你可曾见过一只在街上默默行走的的独脚小狗？

sentences.english: The red chairs, the lamps and the table are from the street.
sentences.chinese: 红椅子，灯和桌子是从街上捡来的。

sentences.english: Usual Englishman or Englishwoman can indicate the road for you on the street.
sentences.chinese: 通常英国人在街上是会给你指路的。

sentences.english: One day during the migration in the street, suddenly heard someone make open challenges to fights.
sentences.chinese: 李世民一日在街上游走，忽然听到有人在摆擂台。

sentences.english: The new laws empower the police to stop anybody in the street.
sentences.chinese: 新法令授予警方可在街上截停任何人的权力。

sentences.english: Mrs. Taylor and Mr. Zhou meet on the street.
sentences.chinese: 泰勒先生同周先生在街上见到面。

sentences.english: The images of women barefoot on the street, handcuffed and tied to a rope, enraged internet users.
sentences.chinese: 被绳子绑住的妇女赤脚走在街上的画面激怒了网民。

sentences.english: Once upon a time a little girl tried to make a living by selling matches in the street.
sentences.chinese: 很久以前，一个小女孩试图使生活在街上卖火柴。

sentences.english: If you park the car in the street , it'll hold up the traffic.
sentences.chinese: 如果你把车停在街上，它将会阻碍交通。

definition: Jiepang (Chinese location-based social networking service for mobile devices, in operation 2010-2016)
to go onto the streets/to go shopping
great streets and small alleys (idiom); everywhere in the city
